Chomotkar! Ebar chol aamra oi graph ta dekhi, otaকে Spirogram chart bole. Oi chhobi ta dekhle tor ei shob volume ar capacity gulo ekdom chokher shamne visualise hoye jabe, aar konodin bhulbi na.

Imagine kor, ekta graph ache.
*   **Y-axis** e aamra plot korchi **Volume**, maane koto ta air lungs e ache (in Liters or mL).
*   Aar **X-axis** e aamra plot korchi **Time**.

Ebar dekh, graph er line ta kemon upore niche ওঠানামা korche, ঠিক jemon aamra saas nei ar chari.

1.  Prothome dekh, majhkhane choto choto wave er moto pattern. Oigulo ki bol to? Oigulo holo aamader normal, quiet breathing. So, oi choto wave gulo represent korche **Tidal Volume (TV)**. Wave er nicherta holo resting expiration, aar oporer ta holo resting inspiration.

2.  Ebar dekh, oi normal breathing er moddhe theke patient ke bola holo jor kore jotota sombhob saas nite. Dekhli, graph ta hotath kore koto ta opore uthe gelo? Oi je peak ta, ota holo **Maximum Inspiration**.
    *   Normal inspiration er peak theke maximum inspiration er peak obdi je volume, otai holo **Inspiratory Reserve Volume (IRV)**.
    *   Aar normal expiration er level theke maximum inspiration obdi total je volume, seta holo **Inspiratory Capacity (IC)**. Dekh, IC = TV + IRV hocche.

3.  Ebar patient ke bola holo oi maximum saas nebar por, jor kore jotota para jay saas chere dite. Dekh, graph ta ki bhabe niche neme elo. Je point e eshe thamlo, ota holo **Maximum Expiration**.
    *   Normal expiration er level theke maximum expiration obdi je volume ta berolo, ota holo **Expiratory Reserve Volume (ERV)**.
    *   Aar oi je maximum inspiration er peak theke maximum expiration er lowest point obdi total je volume ta berolo, setai holo **Vital Capacity (VC)** or FVC. Dekh, VC = IRV + TV + ERV hocche.

4.  Kintu dekh, maximum jor kore saas chere debar por o graph ta ekdom zero te neme asheni. Kichu ta volume (approx 1.2 L) ekhono baki ache. Ei je volume ta theke gelo, etai holo **Residual Volume (RV)**.

5.  Aar duto capacity o ei graph theke bujhe jabi. Normal saas charar por (resting expiration level) lungs e total je air roilo (ERV + RV), ota holo **Functional Residual Capacity (FRC)**. Aar ekdom zero theke suru kore maximum inspiration er peak obdi total je volume, ota holo **Total Lung Capacity (TLC)**.

Graph ta bhalo kore dekhlei bujhe jabi je kon volume ta kothay, ar kon capacity ta konta niye toiri. Chhobi ta mone rakhle formula mukhosto korar dorkar porbe na.

Ki re, ebar clear holo concept ta? Graph ta bujhte parli?

Excellent. Ebar ekta khub important point e aasi. Tui je Spirometer machine ta dekhis PFT lab e, jate phu diye test kora hoy, ota diye kintu shob volume or capacity measure kora jay na.

Bhebe dekh, spirometer ki measure kore? Je air ta lungs er bhetore dhoke aar beroy (movement of air). Kintu aamra ektu aage ki porlam? **Residual Volume (RV)** holo sei volume ta, jeta tui jotoi chesta korish, lungs theke ber korte parbi na. It always remains inside.

Tahole, jehetu RV ta konodin lungs theke beroy na, spirometer ota ke measure korbe ki kore? Korar kono upay nei. Bujhli? Spirometer can only measure moving air.

Ebar aay logical step e. Jodi aamra RV ke spirometer diye measure korte na pari, tahole aamra kon kon capacity gulo o measure korte parbo na?
Sei capacity gulo, jegulor formula te RV ache.
*   **Functional Residual Capacity (FRC)** = ERV + **RV**
*   **Total Lung Capacity (TLC)** = FVC + **RV**

Tai mone rakhbi, spirometry can't measure RV, FRC, and TLC. (NEET PG important).

Tahole proshno uthche, eigulo aamra tahole mapbo ki kore? Er jonno special techniques ache. Primarily 3 te method use kora hoy:

1.  **Total Body Plethysmography**: Etai hocche **gold standard** ba sobcheye accurate method. Tor note e dekh ekta chhobi dewa ache, ekjon lok ekta kaanch er box er moddhe bose ache. Otai holo plethysmography machine. Ete patient ke ekta airtight chamber e boshiye, Boyle's Law (P1V1=P2V2) use kore total gas volume in the chest measure kora hoy. Khub complex physics e na giye mota moti ei tuku jene rakhlei hobe je eta sobcheye bhalo method.

2.  **Closed-circuit helium dilution method**: Ete patient ke ekta known concentration er helium gas er mixture e saas nite dewa hoy. Helium aamader blood e absorb hoy na. Kichu khon por, helium ta patient er lungs er air er sathe mishe jay. Tokhon final concentration maplei, dilution koto ta holo sheta theke initial lung volume (FRC) calculate kora jay.

3.  **Open-circuit nitrogen washout method**: Eta ulto. Aamra jani aamader lungs e normal air e praay 78-80% nitrogen thake. Ei method e patient ke 100% pure oxygen diye saas nite bola hoy. Fole, lungs theke shob nitrogen dhire dhire "wash out" hoye beriye aashe. Total koto ta nitrogen berolo, sheta measure korei aamra bujhe jete pari je shurute koto ta air (FRC) chilo.

**Important Note**: Last er duto method, mane Helium dilution aar Nitrogen washout, ekhon aar use hoy na, egulo **obsolete**. Karon ki? Karon jodi karor lung e "trapped gas" thake, maane COPD er moto roge jekhane choto choto airway gulo block hoye jay aar kichu air alveoli te atke thake, shei trapped air porjonto helium ba pure oxygen poucho tei pare na. Fole, ei duto method FRC ke underestimate kore, maane aashol value r theke kom dekhay. Kintu Total Body Plethysmography ei trapped gas shuddho total volume ta mapte pare. Tai otai best.

Ei porjonto clear? Body plethysmography'r concept ta dhuklo mathay?

Besh! Ebar aamra PFT r sobcheye common test ta niye porbo, jeta holo **Spirometry**.

Tui PFT lab e gele ei test tai hote dekhbi. Patient ke ekta machine e jor kore phu dite bola hoy. Spirometry machine ta basically duto jinish measure kore:
1.  **Volume**: Koto ta air berocche.
2.  **Flow**: Koto jore air ta berocche (mane, volume per unit time).

Ei duto jinish ke measure kore aamra duto type er graph banate pari:
1.  **Volume-Time graph**: Time er sathe sathe koto volume air berolo.
2.  **Flow-Volume graph**: Volume er against e flow koto chilo.

Ebar aay **Procedure** ta te. Test ta korar aage patient ke thik bhabe instruct kora khub dorkar. Na hole report thik aashbe na.
Patient ke bola hoy:
*   Prothome jotota parben jore ar deeply saas nin (Maximal Inspiration).
*   Tarpor machine er mouthpiece ta mukh e niye, ekta 'blast' er moto kore jotota jore aar jotokhon para jay saas ta charun (Forced expiration). Eke bola hoy **Forced Vital Capacity (FVC) maneuver**. Patient ke minimum **6 second** dhore continuously saas charte hoy. Kichu kichu case e 15 second o lagte pare.
*   Tarpor abar deeply saas nite hoy.

Eta sunei bujhtis je test ta kora kintu besh parishromer. Tai er kichu **disadvantage** ache. Ei test ta khub physically demanding. Tai jodi karor recent **Myocardial Infarction (MI)** ba **Stroke** hoyeche, ba khub strenuous physical activity kore esheche, ba just aage smoking koreche, tader ক্ষেত্রে ei test ta kora hoy na. Karon ei extra effort ta tader jonno harmful hote pare.

### VOLUME-TIME GRAPH

Ebar aay prothom graph ta te. X-axis e time, Y-axis e volume.
Patient jokhon jore saas chare, dekh graph ta ki bhabe change hochhe. Shurute khub taratari onek ta air beriye jay, tai graph ta khub khara bhabe opore othe. Tarpor dhire dhire air beronor speed kome aashe, ar graph ta flat hote thake (plateau).

Eখান theke aamra duto khub important parameter pai. (NEET PG / INICET important)

1.  **FVC (Forced Vital Capacity)**: Aamra aagei porechi. Total je amount of air patient forceful expiration e ber korlo. Normally, eta 4.5 L er kachakachi hoy. Aar ei total volume ta ber korte motamuti 5-6 second time laage.

2.  **FEV1 (Forced Expiratory Volume in 1st second)**: Naam ta bhenge por. Forced Expiratory Volume in *first second*. Maane, oi je total FVC ber korlo, tar moddhe shudhu **prothom ek second** e koto ta air beriye gelo. Eta flow er ekta indicator. Jar airway jotota খোলা, se toto beshi air prothom second e ber korte parbe. Normally, aamader FVC'r aashi shotaangsho (80%) ba tar beshi air prothom second ei beriye jawar kotha. Toh, ekjon healthy loker FEV1 hobe praay **4 L**.

3.  **FEV1/FVC Ratio**: Etai PFT'r sobcheye important parameter. Eta diyei aamra mainly Obstructive ar Restrictive lung disease ke differentiate kori. Normally, FEV1, FVC'r 80% or more hoy. So, **Normal FEV1/FVC ratio ≥ 0.8 or 80%**. Kichu guideline 70% o bole, seta aamra pore dekhbo.

Tor note e je Volume-Time graph ta dewa ache, ota dekh. 1 second e koto ta volume beriyeche (FEV1), aar total koto ta beriyeche (FVC) sheta mark kora ache.

Ei obdi thik ache? FEV1 ar FVC'r difference ta clear holo? Ei duto jinish bhalo kore na bujhle kintu pore disease gulo bujhte oshubidha hobe.

Excellent. Tahole aamader Volume-Time graph pora hoye gelo. Ebar aamra Spirometry'r second graph ta dekhbo, jeta aro beshi informative. Seta hocche **FLOW-VOLUME CURVE** ba Flow-Volume Loop.

Naam ta thekei bojha jachhe, ekhane aamra Volume er against e Flow ke plot kori.
*   **Y-axis** e thake **Flow Rate** (Litre/second). Conventionally, graph er oporer dike positive Y-axis e aamra **Expiratory flow** (saas charar flow) dekhai, aar nicher dike negative Y-axis e **Inspiratory flow** (saas newar flow) dekhai.
*   **X-axis** e thake **Volume** (Litre). Ekhane Volume ta Total Lung Capacity (TLC) theke shuru hoye Residual Volume (RV) te giye shesh hoy.

Mane patient jokhon maximum saas niye (at TLC) jore phu dite shuru kore, tokhon theke graph ta shuru hoy. Jotota hawa beriye jay (FVC), graph ta toto ta X-axis e egiye jay. Tarpor patient abar jore saas ney (back to TLC) aar loop ta complete hoy.

Ebar aay ekta **Normal Flow-Volume Loop** kemon dekhte hoy, sheta bujhi.
*   **Expiratory Curve (Oporer half):** Patient TLC theke jore phu dewa shuru korlei, flow rate ta khub taratari bere giye ekta peak e pouchoy. Ei highest point ta ke bole **PEFR (Peak Expiratory Flow Rate)**. Er por, flow rate ta ekta straight line er moto kore komte komte RV te pouchonor aage zero hoye jay.
    *   **Effort Dependent Part:** Oi je initial rapid rise ta PEFR obdi, ota patient koto jore phu dichhe, tar opor depend kore. Etai effort dependent portion aar eta basically boro airway (Trachea, large bronchi) er condition reflect kore.
    *   **Effort Independent Part:** PEFR er por je descending limb ta, ota kintu effort independent. Patient aro jore chesta korleo flow rate barate parbe na. Ei portion ta choto airway'r condition ar lung er elastic recoil er opor depend kore.
*   **Inspiratory Curve (Nicher half):** Expiration shesh howar por patient jore saas ney. Ei curve ta sadharonoto ekta symmetrical, smooth, semi-circular shape er hoy.

Ebar chol aamra dekhi je Obstructive ar Restrictive disease e ei sundor loop tar ki obostha hoy.

| Disease | Volume-Time Curve | Flow-Volume Loop |
| :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **Normal** | Normal curve, 5-6 sec e plateau | Prominent PEFR, straight expiratory limb, normal shape |
| **Obstructive** | Plateau te pouchote deri hoy (**Late plateau**), FVC normal/kom | PEFR kombe. Expiratory limb ta r straight thakbe na, bhetorer dike beke jabe. Eke **"Coving" / "Scooping" / "Dog-tail appearance"** bole. Eta Obstructive disease er **hallmark**. (NEET PG / INICET important) |
| **Restrictive** | Normal time e plateau te pouchoy, kintu plateau ta onek niche thake (**FVC reduced**) | PEFR normal ba ektu komte pare. **Kono Coving/Scooping thakbe na**. Puro loop ta choto hoye jabe. Karon FVC kome geche. Loop ta dekhte choto ar lombachora ("tall and narrow") hoy. |

**Keno "Coving" hoy Obstructive disease e?**
Karone aamra aagei porechi, obstructive disease e choto airway gulo dynamically compress hoye khub taratari bondho hoye jay. Tai, PEFR er por flow rate ta hotath kore onek ta kome jay, fole straight line er bodole ekta concave shape toiri hoy.

Ebar chhobi gulo dekh. Normal loop ta kemon, ar Obstruction e kemon scooped out hoye jachhe, aar Restriction e kemon chotto hoye jachhe, sheta bhalo kore observe kor.

Ei basic shape gulo bujhte parli? Coving/Scooping kotha tar maane ki, sheta clear holo?

Besh! Ebar DLCO'r sathei jorito aaro ekta derived parameter dekhe ni, jeta kono kono case e aamader diagnosis e aaro help kore. Seta hocche **Kco**.

### COEFFICIENT OF DIFFUSION (Kco)

*   **Formula:** **Kco = DLCO / Lung Volume (specifically Alveolar Volume, VA)**

*   **Maane ki?:** Kco basically bolche, **per unit of lung volume**, diffusion capacity koto ta. Bhab, DLCO hocche tor familyr total income, aar Lung Volume hocche total no. of family members. Kco hocche avg. income per capita.

*   **Clinical Use:** Eta specially Restrictive Lung Disease ke differentiate korte help kore.

Aay dekhi, ki bhabe.

**1. Restrictive Lung Disease:**

*   **Intraparenchymal (ILD):**
    *   Ekhane ki hoy? Lungs er parenchyma nosto hoy, tai **DLCO kome (↓)**.
    *   Lungs shokto hoye choto hoye jacche, tai **Lung Volume o kome (↓)**.
    *   Ebar Kco'r formula te bosa. Numerator (DLCO) o komeche, Denominator (Lung Volume) o komeche. Fole, duto katakuti hoye, final result ta **Normal (N) thake**.
    *   Maane ki daralo? Total diffusion capacity komeche, kintu jodi tui shudhu je tuku bhalo lung tissue ache, tar hisheb korish, tahole per unit volume e diffusion thik i ache.

*   **Extraparenchymal (Chest wall/Neuromuscular disorder):**
    *   Ekhane ki hoy? Lungs er parenchyma ekdom healthy. Tai **DLCO Normal (N)**.
    *   Kintu baire theke chap er jonno lungs ta phulte parche na. Tai **Lung Volume kome geche (↓)**.
    *   Ebar Kco'r formula te bosa. Numerator (DLCO) Normal, kintu Denominator (Lung Volume) kome geche. Fole, final result ta **bere jabe (↑)**.
    *   Maane ki daralo? Jehetu kom volume er moddhe normal diffusion hochhe, tai per unit volume e diffusion capacity beshi dekhachhe.

Toh, eta aaro ekta sundor tool to differentiate:
*   **ILD -> (N) Kco**
*   **Extraparenchymal -> ↑ Kco**

Aar jodi kono condition e DLCO bere jay (jemon Alveolar Hemorrhage), tahole Kco o obviously barbe.

Ebar chol aamra puro PFT'r approach ta ke ekta flowchart e summarize kori. Etai hocche clinical practice e aamra ki bhabe step-by-step PFT report interpret kori, tar blueprint.

**Step 1: Look at the Spirometry.**

*   **FEV1/FVC Ratio kom (< 0.7)?**
    *   Yes -> **Obstructive Lung Disease**.
    *   Next step -> **Post-bronchodilator test** koro.
        *   Reversible -> **Asthma**.
        *   Not Reversible -> **COPD**.

*   **FEV1/FVC Ratio Normal/High, kintu FVC kom?**
    *   Yes -> **Restrictive Lung Disease**.
    *   Next step -> **DLCO** dekho.
        *   DLCO kom (↓) -> **Intraparenchymal (ILD)**. *(Check Kco, it will be Normal)*.
        *   DLCO Normal (N) -> **Extraparenchymal**. *(Check Kco, it will be High)*.
            *   Extraparenchymal ke aaro differentiate korte -> RV/TLC ratio dekho.
                *   RV/TLC High (↑) -> **Neuromuscular**.
                *   RV/TLC Normal (N) -> **Chest Wall**.

*   **Spirometry (FEV1/FVC and FVC) shob Normal?**
    *   Yes -> Ekhono patient symptomatic?
    *   Next Step -> **DLCO** dekho.
        *   DLCO kom (↓) -> **Vascular Lung Disease** or **Early ILD**.

Aar jodi spirometry normal thake kintu Small Airway Disease suspect korish, tokhon **FEF 25-75%** ba **Closing volume** dekhte hobe.

Ei flowchart ta dekh. Aamra ja ja ekhon obdi porlam, purotar essence hocche ei algorithm ta. Eta bhalo kore bujhe gelei, PFT'r je kono report tui interpret korte parbi.

Ki re, puro PFT chapter ta ebar ekta single picture e elo? Kono step e kono confusion?
